item.description:
Corresponding Naturalists

Asa Gray, Charles Darwin

and the

Making of American Botany

Lecture by Janet Browne

Thursday, October 21, 6:00 pm

Free and open to the public.

Geological Lecture Hall, 24 Oxford Street.

: : :


Asa Gray’s extensive correspondence with naturalists shaped the early years of exploration and botanical research in North America. These letters brought Gray into contact with Charles Darwin, who became a close friend. With the publication of Darwin’s On the Origin of Species, Gray soon emerged as the key proponent and defender of natural selection in the U.S. Janet Browne, Aramont Professor of the History of Science at Harvard, will discuss their letters, which reflect a warm personal relationship as well as the making of an intellectual revolution. Free and open to the public, Geological Lecture Hall, 24 Oxford Street.
item.name: Naturalists
